headline: Trump Privately Weighs Quitting USMCA Trade Pact He Signed
summary: President Donald Trump is privately musing about exiting the North American trade pact, people familiar with the matter said, injecting further uncertainty about the deal’s future into pivotal renegotiations involving the US, Canada and Mexico.  A White House official, asked about the discussions, described Trump as the ultimate decision-maker and someone always seeking a better deal for the American people.  An official in US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer’s office said that a rubber-stamp of the 2019 terms was not in the national interest and the administration intended to keep Trump’s options open and negotiate to address issues that had been identified.

raw.headline: Trump Privately Weighs Quitting USMCA Trade Pact He Signed
raw.summary: President Donald Trump is privately musing about exiting the North American trade pact, people familiar with the matter said, injecting further uncertainty about the deal’s future into pivotal renegotiations involving the US, Canada and Mexico.  A White House official, asked about the discussions, described Trump as the ultimate decision-maker and someone always seeking a better deal for the American people.  An official in US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer’s office said that a rubber-stamp of the 2019 terms was not in the national interest and the administration intended to keep Trump’s options open and negotiate to address issues that had been identified.

headline: Ford, Lyft, Kraft Heinz, Hasbro, Mattel: Earnings Roundup
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rising in Wednesday's pre-market trading after the January jobs report saw the US economy grow by 130,000 non-farm payrolls last month, double the job growth expected by economists. Companies like Ford (F), Lyft (LYFT), Kraft Heinz (KHC), Hasbro (HAS), and Mattel (MAT) also reported their latest earnings results amid all this fresh economic news. Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman dives into the latest earnings results from top companies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: AI Anxiety Rattles Wall Street's Old Guard
summary: While the Dow Jones managed to notch another record high, the broader market felt the chill of "AI creep" as investors began dumping financial stocks over fears of automation. Coupled with a massive $8.2 billion loss at Ford and lukewarm retail data, the day served as a stark reminder that the AI revolution is now coming for the service sector's bottom line.
